_header: Sir John the Rose one thing there is compiled
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The Flyting of Dunbar and Kennedie’ — 552 lines in 8-line stanzas

CULLl510.First Lines:
Schir John þe ros þair is ane thing compylitIn generale
                    be kennede and quinten…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…Substance & geir & thow ane werdie tucheOne mont
                    falcon about thy craig to rax
CULLl510.Note: 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc, ends incomplete at line 368.

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Schir Johne the rose thair is ane thing compleitIn generalle be
                    sone kennedye and quyntend…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Þe mewit rebald þow shall doune to [ ] rostMy
                    Laurite Lettres and the I louse…
CamMagPep2553.Note:
Another copy of lines 1-28 by Richard Maitland, facing the first page of
                    the original copy in this MS.
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Author: quod dunbar (p. 53); Quod kennedy to dunbar (p. 63)

Banna.First Lines:
Schir Iohine þe ross ane thing thair is compildIn generale be
                    kennedy and quinting…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Tail tellar rebellar Indwellar with the diuillisSpink sink
                    qith stink ad tertara termagorum
Banna.Note:
Headings, ‘Quod Dumbar to Kennedie’ and ‘Quod Kennedie
                    to Dumbar’; note at end, ‘Iuge ȝe now heir quha gat the
                    war’ (f. 154).
Banna.Attributed Title:
The flyting of Dunbar and Kennedie Heir efter followis Iocound and mirrie
                    (f. 147)
